meanings.definition: A gold coin formerly used in India.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in India traded with mohurs for goods.
meanings.sent2: The merchant accepted payment in mohurs for the spices.
meanings.sent3: The king's treasure chest was overflowing with shiny mohurs.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as precious as a mohur in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The sound of mohurs clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 15.244 grams.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a mohur of flour to be added to the mixture.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler measured the gemstone to be exactly one mohur in weight.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a mohur of feathers felt like holding a cloud in her hand.
meanings.sent4: His determination weighed as heavy as a mohur on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The tiny bird weighed no more than a mohur in the palm of his hand.

meanings.definition: To pay or reward with mohurs.
meanings.sent1: He promised to mohur the workers for their hard work at the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: The generous donor decided to mohur the charity with a large sum of money.
meanings.sent3: The magician would mohur the audience with a shower of golden coins.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness would mohur those around her with warmth and gratitude.
meanings.sent5: The coach would mohur the team with praises after their victory.
